layout.title: List all slave sites
layout.message: List all the slave sites created by the front-end user

state.name: List all the slave sites Layout
state.description: This layout allow to display the list of slave websites created by the user

param.name: jmslayout
param.label: Layouts
param.description: Select a layout...

param.name: groupname
param.label: Filter on group name
param.description: When not empty, it allows to only see template that correspond to this group name

param.name: title
param.label: Title
param.description: By default, the title is 'Websites' and defined in a language file. When present, it replaces the default value.

param.name: show_del_btn
param.label: Delete Button
param.description: Show/Hide the delete button.

param.name: show_edit_btn
param.label: edit Button
param.description: Show/Hide the edit button.

param.name: show_new_btn
param.label: New Button
param.description: Show/Hide the new button.

param.name: login_required
param.label: Login
param.description: Require to login on the website to see the list of slave sites.

param.name: eshop_events
param.label: Billable websites
param.description: Enable/Disable the call to the Multisites Plugins or call to the scripts defined hereafter to communicate with your eShop component (ie VirtueMart, ...). When enabled, it is required to have website quota available (see Multisites setting).

param.name: redirect_onSave
param.label: Redirect URL
param.description: URL where you want redirect the user once the action is performed. When empty, you redirect the user to the list of slave site. Otherwise, put the URL that must be used when the slave site is created or edited. The keywords {site_prefix} and {site_alias} can be used in the url.

param.name: payment_script
param.label: Payment script
param.description: When present, it allows to prepare the payment of the slave site. You can give here either a constant or PHP code that must be evaluate before processing the website creation. It is called just after the Multisites Plugins to give a second change to return a payment reference.

param.name: onDeploy_OK
param.label: On deploy success
param.description: Factulative PHP script to execute when the website is deployed with success. It is called just before the possible Multisites Plugins.

param.name: onDeploy_Err
param.label: On deploy error
param.description: Factulative PHP script to execute when the website deployment failed. It is called just before the possible Multisites Plugins.

param.name: redirect_onError
param.label: On error redirect URL
param.description: URL where you want redirect the user when an error occurs. By default, the user is redirected to the list of list of slave sites.

param.name: show_template
param.label: Template
param.description: Show/Hide the template combo box.

param.name: show_templatedescr
param.label: Template description
param.description: Show/Hide the template description

param.name: show_prefix
param.label: Prefix
param.description: Show/Hide the Prefix field

param.name: show_alias
param.label: Alias
param.description: Show/Hide the Alias field

param.name: show_toSiteName
param.label: Site title
param.description: Show/Hide the Site Title field

param.name: show_AdminName
param.label: Administrator Login
param.description: Show/Hide the Administrator Login field

param.name: show_newAdminEmail
param.label: Administrator eMail
param.description: Show/Hide the Administrator eMail field

param.name: show_newAdminPsw
param.label: Administrator Password
param.description: Show/Hide the Administrator Password field

param.name: show_siteComment
param.label: Comment
param.description: Show/Hide the Comment field

param.name: email_Notification
param.label: email Notification
param.description: Send an email notification with the login information. Remark: When a new password is generated automatically by a template, the notification is always set to Yes.

param.name: sender_email
param.label: sender email address
param.description: By default the sender email is the user logged. When present, it is possible to force using a specific sender email.

param.name: sender_name
param.label: sender name
param.description: By default the sender name is the user full name. When present, it is possible to force using a specific sender name.

param.name: email_to_address
param.label: to email address
param.description: By default the email is sent to the new admin user of the new website. When present, it is possible to force sending the email to a specific address.

param.name: email_subject
param.label: email subject
param.description: Subject of the email.

param.name: email_body
param.default: Hello {user_name}, You have been added as a User to {site_name} by an Administrator. This e-mail contains your username and password to log in to {site_url}. Username: {user_login}\nPassword: {user_psw}. Please do not respond to this message as it is automatically generated and is for information purposes only.
param.label: email body
param.description: Put here the text of your email. Keyword allowed are: {user_name}, {user_login}, {user_psw}, {site_name}, {site_url}
